jparsec.astrophysics.photometry

Class Kurucz

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.photometry.Kurucz

  • public class Kurucz
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to manipulate Kurucz models of star atmospheres. Only those models with solar metallicity are supported.

    Reference: Buser, R., Kurucz, R. L., A&A 264, 557-591 (1992).

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Kurucz(double starMass, double starRadius, double starTemperature)
      Constructor of a Kurucz model with solar metallicity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Kurucz

        public Kurucz(double starMass,
      double starRadius,
      double starTemperature)
       throws JPARSECException
        Constructor of a Kurucz model with solar metallicity.
        Parameters:
        starMass - Mass of the star, solar masses.
        starRadius - Radius of the star, solar radii. Used to obtain the surface gravity, must be consistent with mass and temperature.
        starTemperature - Star effective temperature, K. From 4000 to 60 000.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • getStarEmission

        public double getStarEmission(double lambda)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Obtains star emission for the current instance. The flux is given as in the Kurucz model, which is already multiplied by PI. To account for the solid angle it is enough to multiply the flux by (r/d)^2, where r is the star radius and d its distance.
        Parameters:
        lambda - Wavelength in m. Between 47E-10 and 91000E-10 m.
        Returns:
        Emission in Jy. 0.0 will be returned if wavelength is out of range.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getSpectrum

        public Spectrum getSpectrum(int np)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the Kurucz spectrum for the star.
        Parameters:
        np - Number of points in the spectrum. You may need a very high value here to sample properly the high frequency part of the spectrum.
        Returns:
        The specturm.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
